rrr
  • Reference
  • Articles

Fit Reduced-Rank LDA Model

lda fits a reduced-rank linear discriminant analysis model.

lda(x, class, rank = "full", type = "cov", k = 0, quadratic = FALSE)

Arguments

x
data frame or matrix of input variables
class
vector or one-column data frame of type `factor` or `character` that are the class labels of the observations.
rank
of the coefficient matrix to estimate. Default rank = full prodcues the standard multivariate regression technique.
type
the format of the covariance matrix. type = "cov" runs the regression using the mean-centered covariance matrix. type = "cor" runs the regression using the mean-centered, standard-deviation-scaled correlation matrix.
k
small constant to add to the ridge of covariance matrices to avoid singularity.
quadratic
`logical`. If `TRUE` fits a reduced-rank linear discriminant model on an expanded feature space that includes all the input variables, their squares, and all of pairwise cross-products.

Value

`list` containing: a data frame of class

References

Izenman, A. J. (2008) Modern Multivariate Statistical Techniques. Springer.

Examples

data(pendigits)
digits_features <- pendigits[,-35:-36]
digits_class <- pendigits[,35]
lda(digits_features, digits_class, rank = 3, k = 0.001)
#> $G
